name: Easy Back Words Quiz | Word Play | 25 Questions

questions.text: Is this small wading marsh bird a liar?
questions.explanation:
rail.

	Reverse 'liar' to give 'rail' (a small wading marsh bird)

questions.text: Rats in the sky are visible in the clear night sky as points of light?
questions.explanation:
star.

	Reverse 'rats' to give 'star' (which is visible in the clear night sky as points of light)

questions.text: Does it pay a dog to bark in quick sharp bursts?
questions.explanation:
yap.

	Reverse 'pay' to give 'yap' (a dog to bark in quick sharp bursts)

questions.text: Can this hard-wearing twill-weave cotton fabric used for trousers and work clothes be mined?
questions.explanation:
denim.

	Reverse 'mined' to give 'denim' (hard-wearing twill-weave cotton fabric used for trousers and work clothes)

questions.text: Can a light-bodied effervescent beer be regal?
questions.explanation:
Lager.

	Reverse 'regal' to give 'lager' (a light-bodied effervescent beer)

questions.text: Tug at the lower part of the alimentary canal?
questions.explanation:
gut.

	Reverse 'tug' to give 'gut' (the lower part of the alimentary canal)

questions.text: Was the epithet of William Shakespeare drab?
questions.explanation:
bard.

	Reverse 'drab' to give 'bard' (epithet of William Shakespeare) Epithet is a descriptive word or phrase added to or substituted for a person's name.

questions.text: A flow of spirits can find this predatory canine mammal?
questions.explanation:
wolf.

	Reverse 'flow' to give 'wolf' (predatory canine mammal)

questions.text: A tool is used for goods and money obtained illegally?
questions.explanation:
Loot.

	Reverse 'tool' to give 'loot' (goods and money obtained illegally)

questions.text: Warts and all find a long thin hollow paper or plastic tube?
questions.explanation:
straw.

	Reverse 'warts' to give 'straw' (a long thin hollow paper or plastic tube)

questions.text: A sum of money offered for the return of lost property such as a drawer?
questions.explanation:
reward.

	Reverse 'drawer' to give 'reward' (a sum of money offered for the return of lost property)

questions.text: Does the boy turn into an aggressive and surly youth according to British slang?
questions.explanation:
yob.

	Reverse 'boy' to give 'yob' (an aggressive and surly youth)

questions.text: It is debatable whether the chief spirit of evil and enemy of God ever lived?
questions.explanation:
devil.

	Reverse 'lived' to make 'devil' (the chief spirit of evil and enemy of God).

questions.text: Is it right to repel a person who is ignored or despised?
questions.explanation:
Leper.

	Reverse 'repel' to give 'leper' (a person who is ignored or despised)

questions.text: The American or Canadian nappy needs to be repaid?
questions.explanation:
diaper.

	Reverse 'repaid' to give 'diaper' (the name for an American or Canadian nappy)

questions.text: An animal is caught or penned in part of this mechanical device?
questions.explanation:
trap.

	Reverse 'part' to give 'trap' (a mechanical device that an animal is caught or penned in?

questions.text: A device around which magnetic tape, film or cotton can be automatically wound to form loops?
questions.explanation:
spool.

	Reverse 'loops' to make 'spool' (a device around which magnetic tape, film or cotton can be automatically wound)

questions.text: Swallow rapidly in large mouthfuls or plug the waste pipe of a bath, basin or sink?
questions.explanation:
gulp.

	Reverse 'plug' to give 'gulp' (swallow rapidly in large mouthfuls)

questions.text: This single-masted sailing vessel holds pools of water on its promenade deck?
questions.explanation:
sloop.

	Reverse 'pools' to give 'sloop' (a single-masted sailing vessel)

questions.text: Do we beat harshly and flog this sport with a whip or strap?
questions.explanation:
golf.

	Reverse 'flog' to give 'golf' (a sport)

questions.text: A city in north-west Argentina can be found in the atlas?
questions.explanation:
salta.

	Reverse 'atlas' to give 'Salta' (a city in north-west Argentina)

questions.text: Indian government or rule known as raj located the wide-mouthed, glass container?
questions.explanation:
jar.

	Reverse 'raj' to give 'jar' (a wide-mouthed glass container)

questions.text: Let's brag about the style of dress and fashion?
questions.explanation:
garb.

	Reverse 'brag' to give 'garb' (style of dress and fashion)

questions.text: Hence Shrek the ogre is therefore a sentence connector?
questions.explanation:
ergo.

	Reverse 'ogre' to give 'ergo' (a sentence connector such as 'hence' and 'therefore'). Ergo is Latin for 'therefore'.

questions.text: Emphasized these sweet desserts?
questions.explanation:
stressed.

	Reverse 'desserts' to give 'stressed' (emphasized). Hope you enjoyed the quiz.
